      • csvToXml

        public java.lang.String csvToXml(java.lang.String csvData,
                        boolean ignoreNullConstraintViolations,
                        boolean ignoreAllErrors)
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                 ServerStateException,
                                 SOAPServerException,
                                 PermissionException,
                                 SOAPException,
                                 BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: IImportToolsAPI
        Convert CSV data to XML data suitable to be imported by IImportToolsAPI.importXmlData(String)
        Specified by:
        csvToXml in interface IImportToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        csvData - A String containing CSV data
        ignoreNullConstraintViolations - Whether to continue after detecting an empty field in the CSV that corresponds to a property that is not nullable. If false, throws an exception in this situation.
        Returns:
        a String containing equivalent import data in XML format, suitable for import by #importXmlData(String)
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        SOAPServerException
        PermissionException - If the user does not have SOAP Admin permission.
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

      • csvToXml

        public java.lang.String csvToXml(java.lang.String csvData,
                        int dataSet,
                        boolean ignoreNullConstraintViolations,
                        boolean ignoreAllErrors)
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                 ServerStateException,
                                 SOAPServerException,
                                 PermissionException,
                                 SOAPException,
                                 BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: IImportToolsAPI
        Convert CSV data to XML data suitable to be imported IImportToolsAPI.importXmlData(String)
        Specified by:
        csvToXml in interface IImportToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        csvData - A String containing CSV data
        dataSet - An int defining the number of the dataset to be imported. Datasets are ordered by inclusion, and the smallest dataset is always numbered 0. Thus Dataset 0 is a subset of dataset 1, and datatset 1 is a subset of dataset 2, etc. If this param is set to -1, all data will be imported.
        ignoreNullConstraintViolations - Whether to continue after detecting an empty field in the CSV that corresponds to a property that is not nullable. If false, throws an exception in this situation.
        Returns:
        a String containing equivalent import data in XML format, suitable for import by #importXmlData(String)
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        SOAPServerException
        PermissionException - If the user does not have SOAP Admin permission.
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

      • importCsvData

        public ImportResults importCsvData(java.lang.String csvData,
                          int dataSet,
                          boolean ignoreNullConstraintViolations,
                          boolean ignoreAllErrors)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                   ServerStateException,
                                   RequiredFieldException,
                                   DataConversionException,
                                   PermissionException,
                                   SOAPException,
                                   BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: IImportToolsAPI
        Import CSV data. Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

        WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported

        Specified by:
        importCsvData in interface IImportToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        csvData - The data to import, passed as a String. This may not be null.
        Returns:
        Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        RequiredFieldException - If csvData is null.
        DataConversionException - If the data can't be imported because it violates duplicate key constraints, contains nulls in non-nullable fields, or otherwise can't be safely inserted into the database.
        PermissionException - If the user does not have SOAP Admin permission.
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

      • importXmlData

        public ImportResults importXmlData(java.lang.String xmlData)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                   ServerStateException,
                                   RequiredFieldException,
                                   DataConversionException,
                                   PermissionException,
                                   SOAPException,
                                   BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: IImportToolsAPI
        Import XML data. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
        <![CDATA[
        
 ...import XML...
        
 ]]>
        Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

        WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported

        Specified by:
        importXmlData in interface IImportToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        xmlData - The data to import, passed as a String. This may not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        RequiredFieldException - If csvData is null.
        DataConversionException - If the data can't be imported because it violates duplicate key constraints, contains nulls in non-nullable fields, or otherwise can't be safely inserted into the database.
        PermissionException - If the user does not have SOAP Admin permission.
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

      • importXmlDataAsByteArray

        public ImportResults importXmlDataAsByteArray(byte[] xmlData)
                                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                              ServerStateException,
                                              RequiredFieldException,
                                              DataConversionException,
                                              PermissionException,
                                              SOAPException,
                                              BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: IImportToolsAPI
        Import XML data, passing the data as an array of UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string. To improve performance, the XML data string can be wrapped with CDATA tags. For example: 
        <![CDATA[
        
 ...import XML...
        
 ]]>
        Note that importing data through this call does not generate events for the newly imported objects.

        WARNING: this is only supported for administrative database tables (such as User) because these XML import routines do not perform complete data validation tests on imported data. Any other use (claims, policies, etc) is dangerous and is NOT supported

        Specified by:
        importXmlDataAsByteArray in interface IImportToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        xmlData - The data to import, passed as a byte[] for the UTF-8 bytes representing the XML string. This may not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        Set of results of the import (number of entities imported by type, and so on). If the import failed, ImportResults will have the ok flag set to false, and the errorLog element will contain descriptions of the errors that were encountered.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        RequiredFieldException - If csvData is null.
        DataConversionException - If the data can't be imported because it violates duplicate key constraints, contains nulls in non-nullable fields, or otherwise can't be safely inserted into the database.
        PermissionException - If the user does not have SOAP Admin permission.
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs
        See Also:
        IImportToolsAPI.importXmlData(String)

                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                  ServerStateException,
                                  SOAPServerException,
                                  PermissionException,
                                  SOAPException,
                                  BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: IImportToolsAPI
        Rebuild the role privileges data by deleting the priviliges data in the database, and then re-importing the roleprivileges.csv file.
        Specified by:

        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        SOAPServerException
        PermissionException - If the user does not have SOAP Admin permission.
        SOAPException

        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs

      • xmlToCsv

        public java.lang.String xmlToCsv(java.lang.String xmlData)
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                 ServerStateException,
                                 PermissionException,
                                 SOAPException,
                                 BadIdentifierException
        Description copied from interface: IImportToolsAPI
        Export XML data into CSV data. The reverse operation from #csvToXml(String)
        Specified by:
        xmlToCsv in interface IImportToolsAPI
        Parameters:
        xmlData - String containing CSV data
        Returns:
        a String containing equivalent import data in CSV format. The result of calling csvToXml on the result should be an equivalent XML document to #xmlData.
        Throws:
        ServerStateException - Thrown when a request is made at a time the server is in a state that disallows the request.
        PermissionException - If the user does not have SOAP Admin permission.
        SOAPException
        BadIdentifierException - Thrown when an internal public ID doesn't map to a real bean (problem could be that type was incorrect)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication error occurs
